@rasbt i have specific instructions in my prompts:
- do not change anything unrelated to the task at hand
- do not change feature functionality
- do it in phases (break it into phases, describe what you are doing rn, implement only current phase, wait for my input before next step)
- do

I've maintained a list of 20 guiding principles for life over the last 10 years.

Sharing it to close out 2024.

1. Read. Non-fiction and fiction both. Classics and modern. Few important people aren't voracious readers.

2. Be curious. Seek truth. Learn to read a research paper.

If you have ever tried to read free books from sites like Project Gutenberg, you noticed that they can be uncomfortable to read, due to their layouts, type & occasional errors 

This project takes those free books and makes them beautiful (and still free). https://t.co/GQPFSgWXZm https://t.co/XbEtc2O95p

People on H-1B visas getting laid off have 60 days to leave the US.

Many have begun an 11 year long green card process but are 5, 10 years away from getting it. 

Employer lays them off, and it‚Äôs all gone. üôÖüèº

Pack your bags. 

There‚Äôs a solution nobody is talking about:

Job search routine: 3 cold emails, 2 tailored cover letters, 10 career site searches, 15 easy applies, career fairs biweekly, 1-hour exercise + walk, 7 hours sleep. More importantly, track your applications and send follow-ups.

A brief thread: https://t.co/LEdGk66Wtv

I had 1000+ reachouts asking for a job (and other cold emails) but replied to ~10 of them.

Don't make these mistakes:
‚Äîdon't ask for a referral if I haven't worked with you
‚Äîdon't tell me the classes you took, tell me that you've built
‚Äîdon't write > one screen of text

üßµ

1/6

Some basics

1)¬†¬†¬†¬†Have an emergency fund of not less than 1 year of your expenses.

2)¬†¬†¬†¬†Insure: Term, medical, personal accident and fire insurance for your house.

3)¬†¬†¬†¬†Don‚Äôt use revolving credit on your credit cards.

4)¬†¬†¬†¬†Simplify: have two bank accounts, two credit cards
